Name.BusinessNameLine1: Community Action Partnership of Sonoma County

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The purpose of Community Action Partnership of Sonoma County is to partner with low income families and individuals to help them achieve economic and social stability, to build community, and to advocate for social and economic justice.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The purpose of Community Action Partnership of Sonoma County is to partner with low income families and individuals to help them achieve economic and social stability, to build community, and to advocate for social and economic justice.We, as Board members, employees, and volunteers accomplish this purpose by building relationships with clients and communities, embracing diversity, advocating for change in public policy, partnering with other organizations, and ensuring the participation of low income persons in the development and implementation of programs and projects.
IRS990.Description: Head Start - Provide low-income and special needs children and their families with a comprehensive child development program. Approximately552 clients were served and 162 days of care were provided during theperiod covered.

Activity2.Description: Youth Programs - provide for parents and children to build familycommunication skills; summer lunch and academic and recreationalprogramming during summer months; programs in gang risk intervention,mentoring, and school readiness. Approximately 1,205 clients wereserved and 240 days of service were provided during the period covered.

Activity3.Description: Community Capacity Building - The Capacity Building program is an intermediary program to enhance the operation capacity of Sonoma County nonprofit organizations through monetary funding, training and technical assistance. For the twelve-month period, 18 agencies received services under this program. The areas of focus include: Leadership Development, Organizational Development, Program Development, Revenue Development and Diversification, and Community Engagement. The methods utilized to increase capacity are through financial assistance (mini-grants), group training, and customized technical assistance. In addition, the Community Capacity Building Initiative convenes and facilitates neighborhoods and communities to achieve positive social change through strategic partnerships, leveraging and aligning resources, promoting evidenced-based practices and measuring community-wide outcomes.

ActivityOther.Description: Health and Family Advocacy Programs - provide health programs to Sonoma County's low-income population, including para-professional family advocacy services to elementary and secondary schools to link families with community resources. During the period, approximately 3,064 clients were served over 240 days of service.

Emergency Housing - provides for emergency shelter and case managementfor mothers with small children and single women from Sonoma County forup to sixty days. Health needs screening is provided. Approximately434 individuals were served during the period covered.

Housing Assistance - provides financial assistance for households atimmediate risk of becoming homeless, but who have a plan for sustaininghousing. During the period covered, 255 days of care were provided to3,200 clients.

Transitional Housing - provides transitional housing to individuals andfamilies while they seek permanent housing. Operates a variety oftransitional housing units, including shared housing for women andchildren and apartments for individuals and families. Approximately 320clients were served during the period covered.

Financial Literacy - partner with schools, community organizations andprivate institutions to provide adults and youth with an opportunity toincrease financial knowledge and build assets. Approximately 80 clientswere served and 255 days of care were provided during the periodcovered.
Other programs including a school based mentoring program and sponsoring an annual conference on poverty related issues.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: PART I. Line 2. Award contracts stipulate guidelines for expenditures and reimbursements, pertinent to funded proposal, with any necessary amendments or contractual expectations. > Site visits to grantees at 45-60 days into contract to monitor progress, compliance, and answer questions. > Quarterly report due from grantees at 90 days. > Final report due from grantees fifteen days after close of project. > All reimbursement requests verified for work performed and/or materials/equipment/supplies received on site prior to processing reimbursement.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: CAPSC is a guarantor on the Executive Director's mortgage.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Form 990 is emailed to those board members with electronic email services; those without email services are mailed a hard copy of the Form 990 prior to submission and signed by the Board President.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board Governance Committee (of the Board of Directors) annually reviews the Conflict of Interest Policy for necessary updating and investigating any possible or potential compliance problems.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Board of Directors and the Director of Human Resources performed a comparability study for the current Executive Director salary.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The agency's governing documents are located on the agencies website. Conflict of Interest Policy can be obtained at the front desk of agencies primary location. The audited financial statements can be viewed (PDF) on the agencies website or requested at agency's primary location.

In accordance with the IRS instructions for the 2009 Form 990, government grants and contracts that benefit the public have been categorized as Contributions and Grants. In previous returns, government grants were categorized in Program Service Revenue (contracts from government agencies). Please refer to Part VIII, line 1 for details.
